column1: #Text=The polycrystalline Ca3Co4O9 oxide ceramic powders were synthesized by the citrate acid sol-gel reaction method.
#Text=Stoichiometric ratios of highly pure nitrates of Ca and Co were dissolved in distilled water; the citric acid was added in the aqueous solution.
#Text=The solution was continuously mixed at 80 °C in order to form the precursor gel.
#Text=The obtained gel was dried at 120 °C for 12 h in air to evaporate the excessive water.
#Text=Then the dried gel was ground and calcined at 800 °C for 8 h to remove excess organics and to get the Ca3Co4O9 oxide ceramic powders.
#Text=Then the powder was finely ground for bulk platelet samples preparation.
#Text=The powers were pressed into bulk pellets with uniaxial formation pressure of 100, 200, 300, 400 and 500 MPa for further processing, respectively.
#Text=The ceramic samples were obtained by sintering the bulk pellets at 800 °C, via conventional annealing furnace and SPS with certain pressures.
#Text=For bulk platelet samples preparation via conventional annealing furnace, the pellet samples were subjected to furnace sintering at 800 °C for 12 h with a heating rate of 20 °C /min.

#Text=For bulk platelet samples preparation via SPS, the obtained pellets pressed at 500 MPa were sintered by SPS at 800 °C with a heating rate of 100 K/min at pressure of 30 MPa and holding time of 5 min.
#Text=Table 1 presents the sample index and the preparation parameters.
